title: Five people stabbed in Manchester shopping centre as man, 40, arrested
text:
The shopping centre has now been evacuated (Picture: John Greenhalgh/ Kammy Nadeem / MEN Media)

A shopping centre in Manchester has been shut down after five people were stabbed inside.

Footage from outside the Manchester Arndale, shared on social media, showed a man being tasered on the ground by police outside the building.

Greater Manchester Police have since confirmed that five people were knifed in the attack and have now been taken to hospital.

A man in his 40s has been arrested on suspicion of serious assault.

An investigation is being led by Counter Terrorism Police North West and officers are ‘keeping an open mind’ about the motive, a GMP spokesperson said.

Photographs from the scene show a heavy police presence inside Starbucks, with curtains pulled up around the seating area.

North West Ambulance Service said they treated four people on-site earlier this morning, while witnesses described seeing one person in a ‘critical’ condition.

One person wrote on Twitter: ‘Three people just got stabbed in the Starbucks in Manchester Arndale and it’s all been evacuated. This is actually crazy.’

Another said: ‘Just been evacuated from the Arndale. Scary stuff. Instant lock-down by staff. Sirens everywhere.’

While a third added: ‘Went to change my trainers at the Arndale, ended up being screamed at to run and get out as there’s been a stabbing and someone’s running around with a knife.’

Witnesses said one person was in a critical condition (Picture: Cavendish Press/ Ricky Champagne)

One man has been arrested (Picture: Cavendish Press/ Ricky Champagne)

Four people have been treated at the scene (Picture: Cavendish Press/ Ricky Champagne)

A spokesperson for GMP said the suspect has been taken into custody for questioning and appealed for anyone with information to come forward.

They are urged to contact the police on 101 quoting incident number 1055 of 11/10/2019, or call Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111.

Other shops on Market Street are currently closed down and their workers have been sent home for the day.

While customers waiting outside the centre have been told it ‘won’t be opening any time soon’.

David Allinson, centre director of the shopping centre, said: ‘The centre has been evacuated while police investigate the incident.

‘We are unable to comment any further as the incident is currently being handled by Greater Manchester Police, who we will continue to support with their investigation.’

The incident comes just days after the Arndale was shut down following a large group of ‘youths’ who were ‘causing anti-social behaviour towards security staff’.

Shoppers saw a ‘riot van, four police cars and an ambulance’ arrive outside the shopping centre on October 4.

GMP said in a statement at the time: ‘The food court has been cleared and the group are slowly being dispersed out of the main entrance.

‘There is currently a heavy police presence to ensure the safety of other members of the public.’

description: Five people have been stabbed at Manchester Arndale shopping centre this morning, Greater Manchester Police have confirmed.
